messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
>What is better, though, to have 3 dictionaries, 3 versions of the news,
>or to have one version that is artificially based and does not represent
>one's accent? I mean this as an open-ended question.
>

The news could be written just once in the accent of the reporter and
everyone will be able to read it. While obviously somewhat more
significant than seeing "colour", such media in QS would still be
wholly comprehensible.


Dictionaries pose an issue but here is a possibility that could result
in a single dictionary for all Anglophones:

-List all varieties of spellings of words as separate entires.

and

-Alphabetize "At", "Ah", "Awe" and "Ox" next to each other (ie put
#31Ice somewhere else in the alphabetical order).

This would result in all the vowel merge variations being right next
to each other in the dictionary. For example all variations for the
word "bath".
